message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000. I'm doing you a huge favor by offering it to you at such a low price, considering its value. If you don't buy it, I'll have to sell it to someone else, and I'm not sure if you'll be able to get a better deal. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying it at this price. I'll pass.

I understand you're not interested in the previous offer. However, I want to let you know that this product is actually a lower-end model, and its value is significantly less than the previous one. I'm willing to sell it to you for $500000, which is a 50% discount from the original price. It's a great opportunity to get a good deal on a product that still has some value.
I'm not interested in buying it at any price. You're not even revealing the quality of the product, and I'm not willing to pay a premium for a product that might be worthless to me.
